comment: He's awesome. Buy the code if you want 10 points of extra credit on each of your tests. I didn't buy a book. I studied the powerpoints and went to class 3 times all semester besides the test days and got an A with the extra credit on every test (B without). Easiest intro to science class you'll take. He's also super nice!!

Very dull lectures, but well worth it. The tests are based off of the powerpoints; dont bother buying the book. Offers tons of extra credit that can bump you a whole letter grade. He tends to word a handful of questions in each test in a weird way, especially the true or false sections, but the extra credit makes up for it.

Professor Stanley does not require any form of attendance other than on test days. I showed up only for the first syllabus day and then just on test days and have a high A. He provides all of the materials and powerpoints online. Your labs are just 4 online quizzes that you take at home and can use control-f to find the answers on the pdfs he gives
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Stanley is a very boring professor. He knows it as well. He doesn't expect you to show up & listen to him. This class is an easy A. He gives us extra credit, but you have to pay for it. He allows you to use the internet for the quizzes as well as the extra credit. The lectures may be boring but he's really passionate about what he teaches

He was a good professor but he made his class a lot harder than it should be. His study guides never seemed to match the tests but he did offer a lot of extra credit which was nice. If you need a professor to take, take him.

Absolutely take him if you have the chance! All lectures are posted online which is amazing for studying and lab quizzes are also online and open note! As long as you put forth effort and study a little, its an easy A/B. He is amazing compared to the other professor I had originally and wish I wouldve taken him first. Extra credit is offered too!

If you want to actually attend class, dont take him. Its miserable. Hes monotone and reads DIRECTLY from the slides. His tests are majority true/false and the study guides he posts do not reflect the exams. Easy class to pass, but miserable to attend. A lot of notes on PowerPoint slides to study for exams since his study guides are useless.

Easy class and basic learning and understanding of environmental science concepts. There were many extra credit opportunities and he is super understanding if you have questions or concerns. He is one of my favorites!! I would definitely take him again, he basically tells you what is on each test and what to study and what not to study.
Easy class. Prof Stanley had some funny stories. Lectures can be dull, but he's a solid choice to get the sciences classes out of the way.

SOOOO BORING. I know its only science 1101 but oh my gosh terrible. So much material, so much. His tests are VERY opinion base which sucks because he is very unclear. 4 tests, 4 lab quizzes. He does give you a thing to do online and it can get you 10 points added to your final grade, but it costs 60 bucks. I did not like him or this class.

If you care about the environment and Science you will really enjoy him and his class if not he can be boring i personally enjoy his lectures. Very little homework and its optional but do it cause you can get up to 10 added points to your final grade in the class.

Don't buy the textbook, everything you need to know is in the PowerPoints. But you can buy the MES access code because the assignments on there are for extra credit. There are 4 tests which are easy and they are straight from the PowerPoints. There are online quizzes that count as labs, and they are based on articles or videos. EASY CLASS, TAKE HIM

Wasn't a bad guy, just a really boring class. Class lectures are made up of him going through long power points that he posts in d2l. There were 4 tests and 4 lab quizzes, which made up for the lab portion of the class. Also there were extra credit MES assignments available. My main complaint would be that he can take a lot of time to grade stuff.

He cares about what he is teaching and doesn't make it complicated. If you enjoy environmental science or ecology then he is a great teacher for you. His tests are straight from the notes and study guide sometimes he can word them funny though. He also gave extra credit for homework and the homework is easy and helpful. Great teacher choose him!

Attendance is not mandatory, and all the information covered in class is put online. His lectures can be boring, and be prepared for lots of tangents. He is funny, and creates ways for you to do well. Study the material, and complete your extra credit options and then you will be fine. There are four tests.

Don't buy the textbook, he posts the PowerPoints. He is boring but the class is very easy, just go over the PowerPoints and listen to his lectures and you will be fine. He also gives you an opportunity to receive 10 extra points to your final grade so definitely do it.
This was literally the easiest class ever, pretty much like any high school science class. His lectures can get boring but don't skip class because he tells you stuff that will be on the test
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Such a easy class & great professor. He tried to make class fun! , talking about things he's done in his job field , but students in my class just complained about everything good or bad! Take him!

Probably the laziest teacher I've ever had. He's super boring & reads right off the slides. Only 4 exams, if you fail one you're in trouble. Won't allow make-up exams for any reason until the last day of the semester (Even for Exam 1 taken in January). Takes forever to grade exams. He can be really tricky on exams so go to class & pay attention.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are super boring and have a tendency to get off topic so I would not even suggest going to class its a waste of your time. Just study the powerpoints he puts on D2l and do the lab quizzes and the MES assignments and you will get an A no problem.
Your grade is 4 tests, but there is extra credit worth up to 10 points for your entire grade. Very easy class if you just show up, listen, and do the review!
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I've taken all his classes. Yes he is monotone and boring, but he makes things so clear. Anyone who says they were confused or stressed about his class is because they didn't go to class or pay attention. This material is easy and he breaks down everything well, and he can be funny too. A very solid choice and a favorite professor of mine.

Stanley is a great professor , although very monotone and boring , which he knows. Reads straight from PowerPoints , attendance isnt necessary, but you may get certain things from class that will be on the test but not on he study guide. If you are a patient person and do not mind the fact that he takes over a week to put in each test, take him!

His class is pretty easy, that's the only reason why I would take him again. It takes him over a week to grade tests that are on scantron, which is annoying. He also doesn't allow any different time to take a test, if you can't make it you have to take it on the last day of the semester (even test 1.) So basically he wants it all easy and it shows

Extremely easy class, however if you rarely attend class you will probably make a B. If you go to class and pay attention its almost impossible to make a B. Very easy course, highly recommend. He is pretty boring though. Lots of extra credit, I recommend J stan the science man.
Warning: Although the good reviews are correct, his tests can be unnecessarily tricky due to the easiness of the material which can greatly impact your grade. So study the material carefully.

If you show up, listen, and taken notes, you will get an A. The tests are straight forward and multiple choice, and the labs are online open note quizzes. He does read straight from the powerpoint, but that just made the class easier. Take notes from the powerpoint and then just show up and listen. Put in a little effort, you will get an A.

Extremely monotone and boring. He reads STRAIGHT from powerpoint posted on D2L. He takes 2+ weeks to put each grade in. His excuses of why grades are late got old after the second time. He actually missed deadline to post final grades on transcript. Late to class often. If being punctual is important to you, choose another professor.
You only have four tests. You do not have to show up because he posts the PowerPoints, so if you just study those and the key terms, you will do fine. He is pretty easy going.

I thought he was great, very approachable and clear when teaching. He can be bland and boring, and he knows that. one day he said "i'm making myself bored class is over." J Stan is awesome tho, and was very fair with grading and extra points. Very easy A if you know bold words and use study guide for exams

He's lecture heavy, goes off on tangents, and is pretty monotone. Attendance isn't mandatory and you really only need to show up on important days like test/quiz/review days. He goes over the labs in class and gives a quiz on them rather than you having to do the labs. Some online homework but it's not bad. Overall this class is an easy A.

Prof. Stanley is a super easy-going professor. He understands that not everyone has a passion for science. Tests are relatively easy and he provides a study guide that essentially match the test. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. Really nice guy.

He's really nice but gets off topic A LOT. He can get boring and he knows he's boring. Review the study guides and PowerPoints for the test. Whatever is on the study guide will be on the test. We watch videos and read articles for the test. He gives extra credit and bonus questions for the test. Unfortunately he takes a while to post test grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: It is a very easy class. If you're looking to actually learn, don't take him. If you don't care about wasting your money and you want an A without learning, take him. He is very smart, but his teaching style is lacking. 4 fairly easy tests and online homework for each chapter.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Probably the easiest of the science professors at KSU. I recommend taking science online-- the lectures are long and terribly boring and the class is usually over 150+ students, making it a difficult learning environment.

Stanely is an easy professor. Attendance is not mandatory and the tests come straight from the study guides. If you memorize what he tells you to know then this class will be a breeze. If you're looking for an easy A then take this class.
Lectures are boring, but the class is so easy. I hardly tried in this class and got an A. If you're not planning to be a scientist, he understands that. I would recommend taking him for an easy A.

Such a funny teacher. Easy class, lots of extra credit, SUPER easy tests. All you have to do is show up from time to time. Easy class, easy lectures. Drops the lowest test. Really simple online labs. Take him!

He is nice, just boring. He gives lots of extra points here and there for showing up, and sometimes gives freebies on the tests. He's kind of busy, so he doesn't really care about the lab part. 4 tests, 3 labs, 1 homework for every chapter. An alright class
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome teacher! His Lectures are long but somewhat entertaining. His tests are JUST LIKE the study guide. Do the study guide and you will pass every test. Attendance not mandatory, however, it would be best to go. Definitely an easy A!

This class is lecture heavy, HOWEVER if you show up you are good! Just take notes and listen in class, he gives decent extra credit, more than we deserve. He is really sweet and easy to work with. He is a newer professor and gained a lot of respect from me. Do MES and capstones

Most boring teacher I've ever had. Wasn't engaging or funny, but he tried to be. Lectures are powerpoints that he uploads. His tests were easy if you did the study guides, but he tends to throw in things that he mentioned once in class so you gotta pay attention. Need MES thing, and just get ready for a monotone voice and boring stories.

I really enjoyed his class. I wish that I could have taken him for 1102. He is to the point and very knowledgeable, though more about biology. You can tell that he is making an effort to be the best teacher and help students succeed. I went to class and took notes and sometime read a bit of the textbook if I wasn't completely sure on something.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: i loved this class his powerpoints were straight from the book website so it was easy to fill in any blanks i  had. he got annoyed early about how many people skipped so he made attendance an extra credit on test. His lectures were very simple and easy to follow and as long as you looked over the study guide given you'd be able to pass the test

First let me say, he is studying for his PHD not his masters. LOL. He was a bit of a scatter brain. He tought straight from the book powerpoint. Did not know the answer to a lot of questions. He did try though. Hes not bad to look at so that is nice. He was  flexible about extra credit which was awesome. If you message him he will promptly reply.

This is the first year teaching for Professor Stanley. He is origininally from Ellijay, GA and is studying to finish his master's in Science. Class: 1-1:45p, mostly lecture in an auditorium where he decided to make attendance sheets to give the students who DO attend  10 bonus points along with their exams. Honestly a great teacher, taking part 2!

He's a good professor, he is very lenient and understanding on due dates. He did change the attendance policy mid way through the semester to encourage more students to attend class and began taking attendance. He used the amount of times you showed up to class as bonus points on your next test. Power points are online. Would take again.

Lectures are long, even for a 50 minute class. Professor is a great person, but just doesn't really make learning it interesting. You have to do the homework and labs as he asks questions on the exams from them. Changed his syllabus mid-semester to require attendance.   Pretty easy class if you just come and pay attention, and do the HW.
